content.description: Start on the same jug as Fish Flop, but climb the arete instead of the face.
content.location: Right arete of the Fish Flop boulder

content.description: In the middle of the face of the Fish Flop boulder is a large hand hold.  Start here, go left, and then straight up.  Take your time with the top-out!  It's slick, but foot work will bring you home.
content.location: Located in the middle of the southern face.  To walk off, walk to the back (north) of the boulder, down climb to The Desk (the boulder adjacent to Fish Flop, and then slide down the ramp.

content.description: Start on a good side pull and a small crimp at roughly chest height. Use the small crimps and great edges to your left to position yourself for the reach for the fin shaped flake. For an extra challenge you could avoid going left to the edge and head straight up using the undercling below the flake. Move your feet up for a mellow top out. One of the best foot holds is a bit loose. Be gentle.
content.location: Shady Â east side of Fish flop. You know your in the right place when you see the obvious dorsal fin flake

content.description: A good mix of technique and power is required to make it up this boulder.  Sit down start on a left hand sidepull, and a funky right hand.  Right hand up to a decent hold, then work the feet, and squeeze and bump the left hand eventually up to a decent crimp in the middle of the face.  More compression on a few slopers and crimps leads to the top.
content.protection: 2 pads are ok, 3 would be better
content.location: Left arete of the Fish Flop boulder
